scenario_text.value: ...24, 25, 26, 27. Okay, that’s all of them.

I’d better take these to the staff room, then
head back or I’ll miss curfew.

Hello, class president! Hard at work, I see.
Did you finish collecting the handouts?
Oh, hello. Yes, I’m all done.

Goodness, what would this class do without
you, my dear?
You collect printouts, act as president...

The vice president and the person on duty
each day should help.
Goodness gracious... What a shame!

What’s gotten into the other students? It
must be tough doing it all on your own.

Oh... The others seem too busy with their own
stuff, I guess...

So they foisted all the work upon you because
they knew you’d do it? Oh, dear...
It’s fine. I’m used to it...

You shouldn’t have to do this. It isn’t
normal.
Huh...?

Didn’t I ask you to tell me if this happens
again? It’s unfair for you to do everything.
Ah, haha... You’re right.
(It’s true. This isn’t normal.)
(Why does this keep happening...?)
(Why won’t other students work with me?)

(I should listen to the teacher. It’s unfair
that I’m working myself to the bone, alone.)

(Not that he ever scolds them for slacking
off...)

(He just keeps telling me the same things
over and over.)

(But it’s too hard for me to say anything to
the other students.)

(Speaking up for myself has always been so
hard.)
(Until I came to this world...!)
